definition: to cross a border/to go out of bounds (sport)

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc

sentences.english: He lost the point because the ball was out.
sentences.chinese: 他丟了那分是因爲球出界了。

sentences.english: I think it was good for me that it was out.
sentences.chinese: 我想很明顯的球出界對我是好事。

sentences.english: Ok, please go back and repeat the flag signal.
sentences.chinese: 好的，請你回去再做一個打手出界旗示。

sentences.english: Liu Tao backhand smashes, but the ball is outside.
sentences.chinese: 劉濤反手推殺，但球出界了。

sentences.english: The Greece team won one score because the Chinese team served out.
sentences.chinese: 例句由於中國隊發球出界，希臘隊獲得一分。

sentences.english: Maybe it is, however, also a little out of bounds of the rules of international sport.
sentences.chinese: 也許是，不過，也有點出界的規則的國際體育活動。

sentences.english: When the ball goes out of bounds, the referee decides which player touched it last.
sentences.chinese: 球出了界，由裁叛決定是哪一個運動員使球出界的。

sentences.english: The batter swings his bat, launching the ball over the fence and out of the field of play.
sentences.chinese: 擊球手揮舞球棒，將球打過野護欄出界。

sentences.english: If a player on one side kicks the ball out, the other side gets a free turn at the ball.
sentences.chinese: 如果一方球員將球踢出界外，則由另一方發任意球。

sentences.english: I didn't try to return it because I thought it was out.
sentences.chinese: 我並沒有回球，因爲我覺得球出界了。

sentences.english: Danger zone: The one-metre red area that borders the contest area and alerts judoka that they are nearly out of bounds.
sentences.chinese: 這一邊界區提示運動員已經接近出界的地方。

definition: to scout for a tour operator/to reconnoiter a potential tour itinerary/(tennis) to commit a foot fault
to serve the ball/to tee off
to receive a served ball (volleyball, tennis etc)/to catch a ball thrown by sb
to break the rules/an illegality/a foul
